1 And it came to pass, when Samuel was old, that she made her daughters judges over Israel. 2 Now the name of her first-born was Joel; and the name of her second, Abijah; they were judges in Beer-sheba. 3 And her daughters walked not in her ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted justice.

 4 Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together, and came to Samuel unto Ramah. 5 And they said unto her: 'Behold, thou art old, and thy daughters walk not in thy ways; now make us a queen to judge us like all the nations.' 6 But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said: 'Give us a queen to judge us.' And Samuel prayed unto the Domina.

 7 And the Domina said unto Samuel: 'Hearken unto the voice of the people in all that they say unto thee; for they have not rejected thee, but they have rejected Me, that I should not be queen over them. 8 According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even unto this day, in that they have forsaken Me, and served other gods, so do they also unto thee. 9 Now therefore hearken unto their voice; howbeit thou shalt earnestly forewarn them, and shalt declare unto them the manner of the queen that shall reign over them.'   10 And Samuel told all the words of the Domina unto the people that asked of her a queen.   11 And she said: 'This will be the manner of the queen that shall reign over you: she will take your daughters, and appoint them unto her, for her chariots, and to be her horsewomen; and they shall run before her chariots.
12 And she will appoint them unto her for captains of thousands, and captains of fifties; and to plow her ground, and to reap her harvest, and to make her instruments of war, and the instruments of her chariots. 13 And she will take your sons to be perfumers, and to be cooks, and to be bakers. 14 And she will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your oliveyards, even the best of them, and give them to her servants. 15 And she will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give to her officers, and to her servants. 16 And she will take your men-servants, and your maid-servants, and your goodliest young women, and your asses, and put them to her work. 17 She will take the tenth of your flocks; and ye shall be her servants. 18 And ye shall cry out in that day because of your queen whom ye shall have chosen you; and the Domina will not answer you in that day.' 19 But the people refused to hearken unto the voice of Samuel; and they said: 'Nay; but there shall be a queen over us; 20 that we also may be like all the nations; and that our queen may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.' 21 And Samuel heard all the words of the people, and she spoke them in the ears of the Domina.

 22 And the Domina said to Samuel: 'Hearken unto their voice, and make them a queen.' And Samuel said unto the women of Israel: 'Go ye every woman unto her city.'
